AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: Customer-facing replies are written by named agents and contain coherent troubleshooting guidance. The only “AI” content appears as private escalation tags, which are not customer-facing evidence of poor AI output.
evidence: Carlos Encalada commented publicly: "Thank you for reaching out. We’ve received your escalation regarding ticket 60177804 and are actively working on it."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: There is no customer-facing pattern of repeated AI replies blocking access to a human. When the customer requested a meeting, a human agent responded publicly the same day.
evidence: Bennett Duarte commented privately: "Could we have a meeting to take a closer look? Customer really needs this working"
Pablo Ambram commented publicly: "An agent will contact you shortly to propose a meeting."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support requested fresh diagnostics during/around the latest freeze, which is additional time-scoped data rather than an obvious repeat of an already-fulfilled request. The customer does not explicitly state (in a public message) that they already provided the exact requested debug capture/timestamps and is being asked again.
evidence: Arafat Bakhsh commented publicly: "Thank you for sending the logs and support info. We’ve reviewed them and identified several factors contributing to the intermittent 'freeze'"
Carlos Encalada commented publicly: "Please provide a fresh set of diagnostics covering the most recent freeze"

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: Staff responses occur the same day or within short intervals after customer updates/escalations; no 5+ day gap (or two 3+ day gaps) between a customer message and the next staff reply is visible in the provided timeline.
evidence: Bennett Duarte commented privately: "It is still freezing and just froze now."
Pablo Ambram commented publicly (same day): "We have received your escalation regarding the server freezing issue and we are currently working on it."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: Support introduced auto-closure language (“stay open for one week unless…”) while the issue was still active and the customer was seeking urgent help/meeting due to recurring freezes, which risks closing the case before resolution.
evidence: Bennett Duarte commented privately: "Could we have a meeting to take a closer look? Customer really needs this working"
Shaquille De Lancy commented publicly: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."
Carlos Encalada commented publicly: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: Although the customer describes broad impact and frequent freezes, there is no explicit SEV1/P1/critical/outage designation in customer-facing content, and support did engage with detailed troubleshooting and requested time-bound diagnostics. Evidence of mishandling/escalation failure is not strong enough from the provided text.
evidence: Bennett Duarte commented privately: "when it stops, it stops for everyone"
Carlos Encalada commented publicly: "Please provide a fresh set of diagnostics covering the most recent freeze"
